name: friendliness
content:
friendliness noun [U]
(PERSONAL QUALITY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 the quality of behaving in a pleasant, kind way towards someone: She showed great friendliness towards me. The city has a reputation for friendliness.
the fact of being friends with someone: Their friendliness did not in any way lessen their rivalry.
More examplesFewer examplesI can vouch for his friendliness and amenability.Some breeds of dog are known for their friendliness and ability to interact well with humans.We were so impressed by the friendliness of everyone we met on our travels.The media questioned him about his friendliness with Ms Clarke.

friendliness noun [U]
(SUPPORT)
the quality of not harming someone or something, or of being good, helpful, or suitable for them or it: We rate all the routes for safety and child friendliness. Other aspects of the bid will be considered as well as cost, such as environmental friendliness.
the fact of supporting or wanting to help someone or something: The president is known for his friendliness towards oil companies.
More examplesFewer examplesThe hotel scored well for family friendliness.The government has been keen to emphasize its business friendliness.He is a Democrat known for his friendliness towards many parts of the Republican agenda.
